newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dresdner Q1 oper profit before provs rises.
newsitem.headline: Dresdner Q1 oper profit before provs rises.

text.p: (in millions of marks unless otherwise stated)
Group oper profit before provisions 991 up 10 pct
Group own account trading income 330 vs n/a
Group net interest income 1,700 up 8.8 pct
Group net commission income 1,200 up 20.6 pct
Group balance sheet total 625,000 up 11.5 pct
NOTE - Full name of the German bank is Dresdner Bank AG

The results were released ahead of the bank's annual general meeting. Chairman Juergen Sarrazin said in the text of a speech that special factors had influenced earnings positively in the first few months of 1997 and that the results could not be extrapolated for the year.
The rise in operating income understated the earnings development because of the extremely good first quarter in 1996 and a pro-rata comparison would give a rise of 25 percent, he said.

The trading income result was equivalent to half the trading income for 1996 as a whole. Net interest income was boosted by quasi-trading income elements not necessarily sustainable over the full year.
Commission income rose on the back of high turnover in equities and mutual funds, and a rise in asset management fees.
Administrative expenses would have risen 7.3 percent excluding costs related to the first time consolidation of RCM Capital Management.
It was too early to detect significant new trends in loan loss provisioning, but Sarrazin said he did not expect a major increase or decrease in provisioning for the full year.
In the result from the liquidity portfolio, realised gains were posted in particular on bonds, which provided a good basis for further earnings development through the year.
The increase in the balance sheet total resulted from growth in money market business mainly, with lending contributing only 3.5 percentage points to the growth.
